rescuecore2.standard.entities

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • rescuecore2.standard.entities.Edge

  • public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    An edge is a line segment with an optional neighbouring entity. Edges without neighbours are impassable, edges with neighbours are passable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Constuct an impassable Edge.
      Edge(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY, EntityID neighbour)
      Constuct an Edge.
      Edge(Point2D start, Point2D end)
      Constuct an impassable Edge.
      Edge(Point2D start, Point2D end, EntityID neighbour)
      Constuct an Edge.

      • Edge

        public Edge(int startX,
    int startY,
    int endX,
    int endY)
        Constuct an impassable Edge.
        Parameters:
        startX - The X coordinate of the first endpoint.
        startY - The Y coordinate of the first endpoint.
        endX - The X coordinate of the second endpoint.
        endY - The Y coordinate of the second endpoint.

      • Edge

        public Edge(Point2D start,
    Point2D end)
        Constuct an impassable Edge.
        Parameters:
        start - The first endpoint coordinates.
        end - The second endpoint coordinates.

      • Edge

        public Edge(int startX,
    int startY,
    int endX,
    int endY,
    EntityID neighbour)
        Constuct an Edge. If the neighbour is null then this edge is impassable; if it is non-null then this edge is passable.
        Parameters:
        startX - The X coordinate of the first endpoint.
        startY - The Y coordinate of the first endpoint.
        endX - The X coordinate of the second endpoint.
        endY - The Y coordinate of the second endpoint.
        neighbour - The ID of the neighbour on the other side of this edge. This may be null to indicate an impassable edge.

      • Edge

        public Edge(Point2D start,
    Point2D end,
    EntityID neighbour)
        Constuct an Edge. If the neighbour is null then this edge is impassable; if it is non-null then this edge is passable.
        Parameters:
        start - The first endpoint coordinates.
        end - The second endpoint coordinates.
        neighbour - The ID of the neighbour on the other side of this edge. This may be null to indicate an impassable edge.
